instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message:
This board initially was only drawing 20ma  After changing a few components I now have all s0 rails up. Fan spins unit draws 150ma (Occasionaly jumps to over 250ma thern drops back) but  no usb activity/Chime.
I have reballed the smc and tried a bios file from a different forum 
(couldnt find one here)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.58
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.42
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.7V Cpu doesnt get warm.

Smc bypass mode draws same current.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message:
Which areas affected by spillage?

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1vROQOaC9uWbC8wGOXPQTP8-VZglks73i[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message:
Hi thanks, many places over the board.
I trawled through many posts looking for a link to known good bios dumps for this specific board and couldnt find any.I replaced so far <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> corroded and no cpu vcore before replacement, C102 was short, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> had .5v on pin3 before changing it, Spillage under Smc so reballed it (Might replace it and see if it helps). <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> had corrosion and broken trace on it so replaced and fixed trace.

First symptom was 19ma no charger led so current situation is 150ma, fan spin No Usb activity.
All spi resistors checked ok.
Will try one of those bios files .
Do you think there is any point in replacing the Smc? I had a 00165-a recently with something a bit similar and I replaced the Smc and it worked.

All diode reading
L7320 - .0319
L7310 - .0314
L7630 - .099
L7430 - .136
L7560 - .352
L7520 - .418
L7130 - .143
L3095 - .476
L7701 - .418

tried those dumps but still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message:
Heat CPU using quality flux.
Try changing SMC, but is more likely an issue located on PCH/CPU area...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message:
I changed Smc but same issues , then lighty reflowed underside of Cpu/Pch now when apply power it quickly jumps up to over 150ma then back to 19ma and jumps between 19ma and 21ma. Is it possible there is a short somewhere? as there was slight liquid damaged on the underside of Cpu that was short cap <CAPACITOR>C1204</CAPACITOR> which I replaced at start of troubleshooting.

Thanks for your time and input , it is much appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message:
"Heat CPU using quality flux."
"lighty reflowed underside of Cpu/Pch" will not burn eventually crap accumulated underneath CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message: What  I meant was I heat the underside of the board and  used original nc-559 flux and reflowed the cpu/pch then afterwards ran ipa under the cpu

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b spillage
threads.message: If I have all S0 main rails what are the next signals to look for on the board?
